item.title: Jupyter-Lab FINALLY has a TOC extension
item.description:
Huzzah!

I can not overstate my appreciation to Ian Rose for finally allowing me to switch to JupyterLab as my primary interface to Jupyter Notebooks. I tried before but always returned to the old interface due to the fact that I heavily rely on headings to navigate my notebooks as I develop them. My notebooks are usually pretty long and complex so the lack of a “navigation” system really impedes my productivity.

But no longer, thanks to jupyterlab-toc!

To install the extension run the following command:

$ jupyter labextension install jupyterlab-toc

When you restart your jupyterlab server, you will have a new sidebar tab named “Contents” which will open what you see below.

item.title: Hello: blog
item.description:
Greetings

I plan to start blogging through this domain from now on. Generally, I expect to focus on things that would have helped ‘past Gus’ from about a month ago. Things like how I finally managed to solve an annoying python bug or analysis problem. From time to time, I also want to highlight some of the research projects that I contribute to.

All in all, it remains to be seen exactly how this will shape up. But I am excited to have a bit of an active online writing presence again.
